projects.description: Empirical analysis of 10-year structural changes in broadcasting industry net revenue inflow (2015-2024), diagnosing the crisis including government funding at 10.15% (OECD lowest), broadcasting advertising 43.9% sharp decline, and 44-year KBS license fee freeze, proposing an integrated policy roadmap.
projects.description_en: Empirical analysis of 10-year structural changes in broadcasting industry revenue (2015-2024), diagnosing the crisis including 10.15% government funding (OECD lowest), 43.9% advertising decline, and 44-year KBS license fee freeze, proposing an integrated policy roadmap.
projects.summary: Government funding 10.15% (OECD lowest), broadcasting advertising 43.9% sharp decline over 10 years, 44-year KBS license fee freeze - broadcasting industry crisis diagnosis and integrated policy proposal
key_findings: Government funding ratio 10.15% - OECD lowest (KBS license fee 9.36% + Broadcasting Development Fund 0.79%)
Broadcasting advertising 43.9% sharp decline over 10 years (3.50 trillion won to 1.99 trillion won)
KBS license fee frozen for 44 years - real value declined 82%
Shift from advertising-based to subscription-based (49.64% to 25.82%)
IPTV rapid growth +99.1% vs Cable SO collapse -39.1%
Home shopping emergence: 0 won to 2,024.9 billion won (3rd largest revenue source)
Launch of Broadcasting, Media, and Communications Committee (2025.10.1) - budget 242.3 billion won
policy_proposals: KBS license fee normalization and collection rate improvement
Broadcasting advertising deregulation (product placement, virtual advertising)
Platform contribution adjustment and fairness enhancement
Government funding expansion and Broadcasting Development Fund efficiency improvement
